verses.text: O \w that|strong="H5414"\w* thou \add wert\add* as my \w brother|strong="H0251"\w*, that \w sucked|strong="H3243"\w* the \w breasts|strong="H7699"\w* of my \w mother|strong="H0517"\w*! \add when\add* I should \w find|strong="H4672"\w* thee \w without|strong="H2351"\w*, I would \w kiss|strong="H5401"\w* thee; yea, I should not be \w despised|strong="H0936"\w*.\f + \fr 8.1 \ft I should not…: Heb. they should not despise me\f*

I would \w lead|strong="H5090"\w* thee, \add and\add* \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* thee into my \w mother’s|strong="H0517"\w* \w house|strong="H1004"\w*, \add who\add* would \w instruct|strong="H3925"\w* me: I would cause thee to \w drink|strong="H8248"\w* of \w spiced|strong="H7544"\w* \w wine|strong="H3196"\w* of the \w juice|strong="H6071"\w* of my \w pomegranate|strong="H7416"\w*.
His left \w hand|strong="H8040"\w* \add should be\add* under my \w head|strong="H7218"\w*, and his right \w hand|strong="H3225"\w* should \w embrace|strong="H2263"\w* me.

I \w charge|strong="H7650"\w* you, O \w daughters|strong="H1323"\w* of \w Jerusalem|strong="H3389"\w*, that ye stir not \w up|strong="H5782"\w*, nor \w awake|strong="H5782"\w* \add my\add* \w love|strong="H0160"\w*, until he \w please|strong="H2654"\w*.\f + \fr 8.4 \ft that…: Heb. why should ye stir up, or, why, etc\f*

Who \add is\add* this that cometh \w up|strong="H5927"\w* from the \w wilderness|strong="H4057"\w*, \w leaning|strong="H7514"\w* upon her \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w*? I \w raised|strong="H5782"\w* thee up under the apple \w tree|strong="H8598"\w*: there thy \w mother|strong="H0517"\w* brought thee \w forth|strong="H2254"\w*: there she brought thee \w forth|strong="H2254"\w* \add that\add* \w bare|strong="H3205"\w* thee.

¶ \w Set|strong="H7760"\w* me as a \w seal|strong="H2368"\w* upon thine \w heart|strong="H3820"\w*, as a \w seal|strong="H2368"\w* upon thine \w arm|strong="H2220"\w*: for \w love|strong="H0160"\w* \add is\add* \w strong|strong="H5794"\w* as \w death|strong="H4194"\w*; \w jealousy|strong="H7068"\w* \add is\add* \w cruel|strong="H7186"\w* as the \w grave|strong="H7585"\w*: the \w coals|strong="H7565"\w* thereof \add are\add* \w coals|strong="H7565"\w* of \w fire|strong="H0784"\w*, \add which hath a\add* most vehement \w flame|strong="H7957"\w*.\f + \fr 8.6 \ft cruel: Heb. hard\f*

\w Many|strong="H7227"\w* \w waters|strong="H4325"\w* \w cannot|strong="H3201"\w* \w quench|strong="H3518"\w* \w love|strong="H0160"\w*, neither can the \w floods|strong="H5104"\w* \w drown|strong="H7857"\w* it: if \add a\add* \w man|strong="H0376"\w* would \w give|strong="H5414"\w* all the \w substance|strong="H1952"\w* of his \w house|strong="H1004"\w* for \w love|strong="H0160"\w*, it would \w utterly|strong="H0936"\w* be \w contemned|strong="H0936"\w*.

¶ We have a \w little|strong="H6996"\w* \w sister|strong="H0269"\w*, and she hath no \w breasts|strong="H7699"\w*: what shall we \w do|strong="H6213"\w* for our \w sister|strong="H0269"\w* in the \w day|strong="H3117"\w* when she shall be spoken \w for|strong="H1696"\w*?

If she \add be\add* a \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*, we will \w build|strong="H1129"\w* upon her a \w palace|strong="H2918"\w* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*: and if she \add be\add* a \w door|strong="H1817"\w*, we will \w inclose|strong="H6696"\w* her with \w boards|strong="H3871"\w* of \w cedar|strong="H0730"\w*.

I \add am\add* a \w wall|strong="H2346"\w*, and my \w breasts|strong="H7699"\w* like \w towers|strong="H4026"\w*: then was I in his \w eyes|strong="H5869"\w* as one that \w found|strong="H4672"\w* \w favour|strong="H7965"\w*.\f + \fr 8.10 \ft favour: Heb. peace\f*

\w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w* had a \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* at \w Baal-hamon|strong="H1174"\w*; he let \w out|strong="H5414"\w* the \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w* unto \w keepers|strong="H5201"\w*; every \w one|strong="H0376"\w* for the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* thereof was to \w bring|strong="H0935"\w* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w* \add pieces\add* of \w silver|strong="H3701"\w*.

My \w vineyard|strong="H3754"\w*, which \add is\add* mine, \add is\add* \w before|strong="H6440"\w* me: thou, O \w Solomon|strong="H8010"\w*, \add must have\add* a \w thousand|strong="H0505"\w*, and those that \w keep|strong="H5201"\w* the \w fruit|strong="H6529"\w* thereof two \w hundred|strong="H3967"\w*.

Thou that \w dwellest|strong="H3427"\w* in the \w gardens|strong="H1588"\w*, the \w companions|strong="H2270"\w* \w hearken|strong="H7181"\w* to thy \w voice|strong="H6963"\w*: cause me to \w hear|strong="H8085"\w* \add it\add*.

¶ Make \w haste|strong="H1272"\w*, my \w beloved|strong="H1730"\w*, and be thou \w like|strong="H1819"\w* to a \w roe|strong="H6643"\w* or to a \w young|strong="H6082"\w* \w hart|strong="H0354"\w* upon the \w mountains|strong="H2022"\w* of \w spices|strong="H1314"\w*.\f + \fr 8.14 \ft Make…: Heb. Flee away\f*
